revised_title: Juda Hirsch Quastel: A Pioneering Biochemist
tldr: Juda Hirsch Quastel was a prominent biochemist who made significant contributions to the field of biochemistry over a 60-year career. Born in Sheffield, England, to Jewish immigrant parents, Quastel was a curious and intelligent child who developed a passion for chemistry from a young age. He attended Sheffield Central Secondary School, where he excelled in science and history. After completing his education, Quastel went on to study at the Imperial College of Science and later made important discoveries in the fields of fermentation, respiration, and enzyme kinetics. His work had a significant impact on the development of biochemistry and earned him a place among the most influential scientists of his time.
